com.github.methylene.sym

Class Permutation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Permutation>

    public final class Permutation
extends Object
implements Comparable<Permutation>
    An instance of this class represents a permutation of at most Integer.MAX_VALUE values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Permutation

        public Permutation(int[] posmap)
        Parameters:
        posmap - A list of numbers that specifies the permutation in zero-based one-line notation. For example, posmap = new int[]{1, 2, 0} creates the permutation that sends new char[]{'a', 'b', 'c'} to new char[]{'c', 'a', 'b'}.

    • Method Detail

      • perm1

        public static Permutation perm1(int... posmap1based)
        Parameters:
        posmap1based - Permutation definition in 1-based one-line notation.
        Returns:
        The permutation defined by posmap1based.

      • cycle

        public static Permutation cycle(int... cycle)
        Parameters:
        cycle - A list of numbers that defines a permutation in 0-based cycle notation
        Returns:
        The permutation defined by cycle.

      • cycle1

        public static Permutation cycle1(int... cycle1based)

      • swap

        public static Permutation swap(int i,
               int j)
        Parameters:
        i - a positive integer
        j - a positive integer
        Returns:
        The permutation of length Math.max(i, j) that swaps the elements at indexes i and j (0-based).

      • from

        public static Permutation from(Object[] a,
               Object[] b)
        Parameters:
        a - An array of distinct objects. null is allowed to appear once.
        b - An array that contains, for each element a[i], exactly one element b[j] such that Objects.equals(a[i], b[j]) is true.
        Returns:
        A permutation so that Arrays.equals(Permutation.from(a, b).apply(a), b) is true.

      • from

        public static Permutation from(Object[] a,
               Object[] b,
               Comparator comparator)
        Parameters:
        a - An array of distinct objects. null is not allowed.
        b - An array of distinct objects that contains, for each element a[i], exactly one element b[j] such that comparator.compare(a[i], b[j]) == 0.
        comparator - A comparator that compares objects in a and b so that they are distinct.
        Returns:
        A permutation so that Arrays.equals(Permutation.from(a, b).apply(a), b) is true.

      • from

        public static Permutation from(Comparable[] a,
               Comparable[] b)
        Parameters:
        a - An array of distinct objects. null is not allowed.
        b - An array that contains, for each element a[i], exactly one element b[j] such that a[i].compareTo(b[j]) == 0.
        Returns:
        A permutation so that Arrays.equals(Permutation.from(a, b).apply(a), b) is true.

      • from

        public static Permutation from(int[] a,
               int[] b)
        Parameters:
        a - An array of distinct numbers.
        b - An array that contains, for each number a[i], exactly one number b[j] such that a[i] == b[j]
        Returns:
        A permutation so that Arrays.equals(Permutation.from(a, b).apply(a), b) is true.

      • random

        public static Permutation random(int length)
        Parameters:
        length - The length of arrays that the result can be applied to.
        Returns:
        A random permutation that can be applied to an array of length length.

      • identity

        public static Permutation identity(int length)
        Parameters:
        length - The length of arrays that the resulting permutation can be applied to.
        Returns:
        The identity permutation that can be applied to an array of length length.
        See Also:
        isIdentity()

      • comp

        public Permutation comp(Permutation other)
        Parameters:
        other - A permutation of the same length as this.
        Returns:
        The composition of this and other. If i is an int such that 0 < i < this.length(), the following identity holds: this.apply(other.apply(i)) == this.comp(other).apply(i)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this.length() != other.length()

      • pad

        public Permutation pad(int targetLength)
        Parameters:
        targetLength - A number that is not smaller than this.length.
        Returns:
        A permutation such that, for a non-negative number m < targetLength 
        
   this.pad(n).apply(m) = this.apply(m) // if m is smaller than this.length
   this.pad(n).apply(m) // otherwise

      • prod

        public static Permutation prod(Permutation... permutations)
        Parameters:
        permutations - An array of permutations, all of which have the same length.
        Returns:
        The product (composition) of permutations, or a permutation of length 0 if permutations is empty.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If not all permutations have the same length.

      • prod

        public static Permutation prod(Iterable<Permutation> permutations)
        Parameters:
        permutations - A list of permutations, all of which must have the same length.
        Returns:
        The product (composition) of permutations, or a permutation of length 0 if permutations is empty.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If not all permutations have the same length.

      • pow

        public Permutation pow(int n)
        Parameters:
        n - any integer
        Returns:
        If n is positive, the product this.comp(this)[...]comp(this) (n times). If n is negative, the product this.comp(this.invert)[...]comp(this.invert) (-n times). Otherwise, the identity permutation of length this.length.

      • invert

        public Permutation invert()
        Returns:
        A permutation that satisfies this.invert().apply(this.apply(i)) == i for any int i such that 0 < i < this.length().

      • insert

        public static Permutation insert(int i,
                 int j)
        Parameters:
        i - A non-negative integer
        j - A non-negative integer
        Returns:
        A permutation of length Math.max(i, j) that moves the element at index i to index j and shifts the elements at indexes between i and j as necessary. Examples: 
        
   Permutation.insert(0, 2).pad(5).apply("12345");
   => 23145
   
        
   Permutation.insert(3, 1).pad(5).apply("12345");
   => 14235

      • orbitLength

        public int orbitLength(int pos)
        Parameters:
        pos - A non negative number which is smaller than this.length()
        Returns:
        The minimum number of times that apply must be written in an expression of the form apply(...(apply(pos))...) so that it returns pos.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If pos < 0 or pos >= this.length.

      • orbit

        public int[] orbit(int pos)
        Parameters:
        pos - A non negative number which is smaller than this.length()
        Returns:
        The minimum number of times that apply must be written in an expression of the form apply(...(apply(pos))...) so that it returns pos.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If pos < 0 or pos >= this.length.

      • order

        public int order()
        Returns:
        The minimum number of times that comp must be written in an expression of the form this.comp(this)...comp(this) so that it returns the identity.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If pos < 0 or pos >= this.length.
        See Also:
        isIdentity()

      • isCycle

        public boolean isCycle()
        Returns:
        true if there are numbers n_0 ... n_k so that this.equals(cycle(n_0, ..., n_k)).

      • toCycles

        public List<Permutation> toCycles()
        Returns:
        A list of Permutations so that p.isCycle() is true for each element p in that list and this.equals(prod(this.toCycles())). An identity permutation will not be contained in the return value.
        See Also:
        isIdentity()

      • toTranspositions

        public List<Permutation> toTranspositions()
        Returns:
        A list of permutations, each of which is if the form swap(i, j) for some i != j, so that this.equals(prod(this.toTranspositions())).
        See Also:
        prod(com.github.methylene.sym.Permutation...), swap(int, int)

      • signum

        public int signum()
        Returns:
        1 if this permutation can be written as an even number of transpositions, -1 otherwise.

      • reverse

        public static Permutation reverse(int length)
        Parameters:
        length - A non negative number
        Returns:
        A permutation of length length that reverses its input. Example: 
        
   Permutation.reverse(5).apply("12345");
   => 54321

      • isReverse

        public boolean isReverse()
        Returns:
        true if this permutation reverses or "flips" its input.
        See Also:
        reverse(int)

      • isIdentity

        public boolean isIdentity()
        Returns:
        true if this.apply(pos) == pos for all integers pos >= 0, pos < this.length().

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns:
        The length that an array must have so that this permutation can be applied to it.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this permutation. This representation may change in the future.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object other)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        other - another object
        Returns:
        true if the other object is a Permutation and has the exact same posmap. In particular this returns false if this.length() != other.length().

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Permutation other)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Permutation>
        Parameters:
        other - A permutation, not necessarily of the same length
        Returns:
        The result of lexicographic comparison of this.posmap and other.posmap. This is compatible with equals

      • apply

        public int apply(int pos)
        Parameters:
        pos - A non negative number which is smaller than this.length()
        Returns:
        The index that an element a[pos] an array a will have, after this permutation has been applied to a.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If pos < 0 or pos >= this.length.

      • apply

        public String[] apply()
        Returns:
        The result of applying this permutation to the incrementing array of distinct strings of length this.length() that starts with "a", "b", "c"... and so on.
        See Also:
        apply(String[])

      • sort

        public static Permutation sort(Comparable[] distinct)
        Parameters:
        distinct - An array of distinct comparables. Null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        The permutation that sorts distinct
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If distinct contains duplicate values.
        See Also:
        sort(java.lang.Object[], java.util.Comparator)

      • sort

        public static Permutation sort(Object[] distinct,
               Comparator comparator)
        Parameters:
        distinct - An array of objects that are distinct according to the comparator. Null is not allowed.
        comparator - A comparator which satisfies comparator.compare(distinct[i], distinct[j]) != 0 for all non-negative numbers i, j such that i != j, i < distinct.length and j < distinct.length.
        Returns:
        The permutation that sorts distinct. If sorted is the result of sorting distinct, the following holds for all non-negative integers i < distinct.length: 
        
   distinct[i] = sorted[Permutation.sort(distinct).apply(i)]
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If distinct contains duplicate values.

      • getPosmap

        public int[] getPosmap()
        Returns:
        A copy of the index map that represents this permutation.
